result.execSummary:
The defendant Raymond Antonio Baker was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Raymond Antonio Baker is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Raymond Antonio Baker was found guilty of Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 9/21/16.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
Consecutive to: to any other sentence. THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Raymond Antonio Baker

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
AS TO COUNT 1:  Case set for jury trial.  State's essential witness failed to appear.  State has no alternative theory of prosecution.  Defense motion to dismiss is granted by the Court without prejudice.  
.
AS TO COUNT 2 AS AMENDED:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.
*
  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 119 days in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 119 days time served. THIS IS A TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.  Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs and surcharges by 9/21/16.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

Defendant Raymond Antonio Baker in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
AS TO COUNT 2:  Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of State, Court ordered penalty enhancer, Repeater, dismissed.

Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court, defendant Raymond Antonio Baker not in court, in custody.  Porchia Sharese Lewand appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 9/21/15 in Branch 40.  State will hold the offer open until 9/17/15.
from the defense received and filed.  rmm
Speedy trial demand.
Final pre-trial scheduled for 09-10-2015 at 08:30 a.m.  Jury trial scheduled for 09-21-2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Defendant Raymond Antonio Baker in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Defendant Raymond Antonio Baker in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant has two cases before the court.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.
Defense counsel enters a speedy trial demand.  Court orders case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 40.  Court advises defendant that all conditions of bail remain as previously set including the No Contact Order.

records.descr: Motion and order for withdrawal of counsel

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Raymond Antonio Baker in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
BRANCH 23 FOR BRANCH 40
Defense counsel motioned the court to withdraw as counsel for reasons placed on the record. Discussion regarding defendant's speedy trial demand. Court VACATED the Jury Trial. Case set for Status of Counsel/Motion Hearing in branch 40.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 08:30 am.
As Branch 40 is in trial, Branch 23 agreed to hear the motion to withdraw.  Matter sent there forthwith.
Email from Attorney Williams received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.   rmm

Attorney Torrie R. Williams in court, defendant Raymond Antonio Baker not in court, in custody.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.  Court ordered final pretrial and jury trial reset as a speedy demand has been filed.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Final pre-trial scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.
for Bail Reduction or Modification received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  rmm
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND received and filed.  ENTRY MADE WITHOUT COURT FILE.  rmm

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge KREMERS.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Dallet, Br. 40. Case adjourned for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial to branch 40.

Defendant Raymond Antonio Baker NOT in court with attorney Torrie R. Williams.  Defendant Raymond Antonio Baker in custody.  Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant NOT produced. Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Parties are notified that effective August 1, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to Judge Jeffrey Kremers, Branch 36 in Courthouse room 502. Discussion regarding joinder of 15CM1499 & 15CM1726 for trial. Court ordered state to file joinder motion with the court 10 DAYS prior to Final Pretrial date. Court to address joinder at Final Pretrial date.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 5, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for August 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with:; Vanessa M.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Raymond Antonio Baker in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Raymond Antonio Baker in custody. 
Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  
Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
